title: Worst footballer tattoo ever? Serbian defender gets wife's face inked onto his torso… and it's TERRIFYING
text:
Sport Worst footballer tattoo ever? Serbian defender gets wife's face inked onto his torso… and it's TERRIFYING Given how bad some footballer tattoos can be, this is a bold shout - but we challenge you to find a tat worse than this Share Wait until you see what is now under that shirt… (Photo: Photonews) Share Get daily     
Footballers and tattoos has long been a bad mix. 
Body ink now seems to be a compulsory part of the unofficial footballer uniform. Whether it be an over-the-top sleeve or a crudely covered torso, there are now countless examples of professional players with truly terrible tats. 
However, even in this fiercely competitive field, we are pretty confident that Serbian defender Uros Vitas is now the proud owner of football's worst tattoo. Uros Vitas: the Serbian defender with football's most bizarre body art (Photo: Photonews) 
Before we reveal the full horror of the body ink in question, we should point out that the 24 year-old - who plays for Belgian side Mechelen - clearly has his heart in the right place. 
He wanted to get a tattoo which showed how much he loves his wife, Andrijana. He wanted a permanent reminder of her beauty. He wanted something that would make her happy for years to come. 
Just one question: why would he assume that a scary face with no edges would do any of those things? Anyone else seeing that image on Vitas' torso and thinking of Homer Simpson's make-up gun? Like us on Facebook
